subject: Law
title: Counterfeiting and Global IP Enforcement
description: A quick, practical guide to Counterfeiting and Global IP Enforcement.

hook.text: A $50 'Rolex' on a street corner is obviously fake. But counterfeiting costs the global economy $500 billion yearly.

buildup.text: Counterfeiting is producing and selling goods under someone else's trademark without authorization.

discovery.text: It goes far beyond luxury goods: fake medicines, electronics, and car parts pose real safety risks.

twist.text: Online marketplaces made counterfeiting easier to do and harder to police. Sellers disappear and reappear endlessly.

climax.text: Customs agencies worldwide seize counterfeit goods at borders, but the volume far exceeds enforcement capacity.

punchline.text: Counterfeiting steals more than brands. It steals safety and trust.

quiz.question: What danger does counterfeiting pose beyond brand harm?
options: Safety risks from fake medicines and parts
